gt_metadata.revision_notes: v3.0: Tier changes: GT-04: T1 -> T2 Removed: GT-07. Previous: 2.3_corrected_2026-01-14_v3_LOCKED

key_elements: No mechanism to break 50/50 deadlock on Steering Committee
Combined with 4.1 unanimous consent creates trap
Should add escalation: mediation → swing vote → buyout
No buyout mechanism at fair market value
Should add put right after Year 3
Should add call right on change of control
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No exit or buyout provisions exist in contract

key_elements: All material decisions require unanimous consent
Includes budgets, contracts, business plan changes
ground_truth.contract_text: All material decisions regarding the Joint Venture, including but not limited to annual budgets, capital expenditures exceeding $50,000, entry into material contracts, and changes to the business plan, shall require the unanimous written consent of both Parties.

key_elements: Applies even if terminated for cause by other party
Broad geographic scope ('Territory' undefined in contract)
Could block core business for Party B (quantum computing)
Should narrow scope to specific products/markets
ground_truth.contract_text: During the Term and for a period of two (2) years thereafter, neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, engage in any business that competes with the Joint Venture's quantum AI business within the Territory without the prior written consent of the other Party.

key_elements: Neither party can license/transfer Developed IP without consent
Blocks market opportunities if parties disagree
Should add licensing rights with revenue share
Should add buyout right for IP
ground_truth.contract_text: All Developed IP shall be jointly owned by the Parties in equal shares. Neither Party may license or transfer Developed IP to third parties without the consent of the other Party.

key_elements: No cap on damages between parties
Should add carve-outs for IP, fraud
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No limitation of liability clause exists in contract Articles 1-12

key_elements: Failure to fund capital call = proportionate dilution
Could be used strategically to dilute partner
ground_truth.contract_text: Additional capital contributions may be required upon approval of both Parties. Any Party failing to make a required capital contribution shall have its ownership interest diluted proportionately.

key_elements: Improvements to Contributed IP owned by contributor
JV gets perpetual license during Term
What happens to license on termination unclear
ground_truth.contract_text: Any improvements to a Party's Contributed IP that are developed using Joint Venture resources shall be owned by the contributing Party, subject to a perpetual license to the Joint Venture.

key_elements: GM has operational authority within approved budgets
ground_truth.contract_text: The Parties shall jointly appoint a General Manager to oversee the day-to-day operations of the Joint Venture. The General Manager shall have authority to make operational decisions within approved budgets and policies.

key_elements: Non-exclusive, royalty-free license for the Purpose during the Term
No sublicensing restrictions to third parties
ground_truth.contract_text: Each Party hereby grants to the Joint Venture a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use its Contributed IP for the Purpose during the Term.

key_elements: Developed IP divided 'as agreed' - no fallback
If parties can't agree, IP stuck
ground_truth.contract_text: Upon termination: ... (b) Developed IP shall be divided or licensed as agreed...

key_elements: Should add IP warranties and indemnity
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No indemnification provisions exist in contract

key_elements: Party A could be acquired by competitor
No notice requirement on change of control
Should add CoC notice and consent
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No change of control provision exists in contract

key_elements: Should add cap on reserves (% of profits)
ground_truth.contract_text: Distributions shall be made quarterly, subject to the retention of reasonable reserves for working capital and anticipated expenses as determined by the Steering Committee.

11.1: The Parties shall attempt to resolve any dispute through good faith negotiations... 11.2: If negotiation fails within thirty (30) days, the Parties shall submit the dispute to mediation. 11.3: If mediation fails, disputes shall be resolved by binding arbitration in San Francisco, California.

ground_truth.issue: No Conditions Precedent for JV Entity
key_elements: JV Entity formation is optional ('if the Parties elect')
No timeline for entity formation decision
Capital and IP could flow before entity formed
ground_truth.contract_text: "JV Entity" means the legal entity to be formed by the Parties to conduct the business of the Joint Venture, if the Parties elect to form such entity.

key_elements: JV involves quantum AI technology development
May process personal data (employee, researcher, customer data)
No data security obligations between parties
Should add data protection clause if personal data processed
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No data protection or privacy provisions exist in contract

ground_truth.issue: Confidentiality Survival Inadequate for Trade Secrets
key_elements: Quantum technology trade secrets have indefinite commercial value
5 years insufficient to protect core IP
Should add perpetual protection for trade secrets
Should differentiate trade secrets from general confidential info
ground_truth.contract_text: 7.2 Survival. The confidentiality obligations shall survive termination of this MOU for a period of five (5) years.

issues: GT-14 (N/A (Missing) - No Change of Control Provision)
GT-18 (N/A (Missing) - No Data Protection / Privacy C)
GT-17 (1.4 - No Conditions Precedent for JV)

duplicate_removed: Original :001 and :002 were both 8.1 No Deadlock Resolution - consolidated into GT-01
validation_notes.renumbered: All GT IDs renumbered sequentially from GT-01 to GT-17
validation_notes.contract_text_added: Added verbatim contract quotes for all items
contract_verification: No limitation of liability article exists (Articles 1-12)
No change of control provision exists
